Package com.example.happymeals.database

Class FireStoreManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.happymeals.database.FireStoreManager
  • public class FireStoreManager
extends java.lang.Object
    See Also:
    As used interface to subscribe to successful data requests. FireStoreManager is responsible for instantiating a connectino to the database as well as getting and setting requested values in the databse. Contains global which holds the documents for representing the users collections of data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FireStoreManager

        public FireStoreManager()
        Class constructor. This will connect to the Firebase database. Finding the local IP address of the device being used as the document name that will hold user's collections.

    • Method Detail

      • addData

        public void addData​(Constants.COLLECTION_NAME collectionName,
                    DatabaseObject data)
        Requires a collection name and document name which will lead to a specific data set. addData() will set the document's data to the the arrtibutes of the given object. The attributes given must be from a getAttrName() method or Firestore will not be able to translate it to a document. This will override any pre-existing data in the request document.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - The Enum of the collection which holds desired document.
        data - DatabaseObject holding data to be stored in the document.

      • addData

        public void addData​(com.google.firebase.firestore.CollectionReference collection,
                    DatabaseObject data)
        Requires a collection name and document name which will lead to a specific data set. addData() will set the document's data to the the arrtibutes of the given object. The attributes given must be from a getAttrName() method or Firestore will not be able to translate it to a document. This will override any pre-existing data in the request document.
        Parameters:
        collection - The CollectionReference of the collection which holds desired document.
        data - DatabaseObject holding data to be stored in the document.

      • deleteDocument

        public void deleteDocument​(Constants.COLLECTION_NAME collectionName,
                           java.lang.String documentName)
        Requires a collection name and document name which will lead to a specific dataset. deleteDocument() will remove the requested document and all it's entries from the database. If no such document exists but the path specified is valid the request will still be successful.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - The Enum of the collection name that holds all data entries.
        documentName - The String of the document name which should hold the specific data entry to be deleted.

      • deleteDocument

        public void deleteDocument​(com.google.firebase.firestore.CollectionReference collection,
                           java.lang.String documentName)
        Requires a collection name and document name which will lead to a specific dataset. deleteDocument() will remove the requested document and all it's entries from the database. If no such document exists but the path specified is valid the request will still be successful.
        Parameters:
        collection - The CollectionReference of the collection name that holds all data entries.
        documentName - The String of the document name which should hold the specific data entry to be deleted.

      • getAllFrom

        public void getAllFrom​(com.google.firebase.firestore.CollectionReference collection,
                       DatabaseListener listener,
                       DatabaseObject requestClassType)
        This will call the listener function for all data objects found in the collection requested.
        Parameters:
        collection - CollectionReference of documents holding the data being requested.
        listener - DatabaseListener that holds the method that will be called on the success of data fetching.
        requestClassType - DatabaseObject which will define the type of class to cast the fetched data to.

      • getData

        public void getData​(Constants.COLLECTION_NAME collectionName,
                    java.lang.String documentName,
                    DatabaseListener listener,
                    DatabaseObject requestClassType)
        Finds the document located in the given path and calls the listener function. At this time the proper class will be created from the fetched data and passed as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - The Enum representing the collection name where the document is located.
        documentName - The String representing the document name that is being removed from the given collection.
        listener - The Class which impliments the DatabaseListener and holds the listener for the success of data fetching.
        requestClassType - The DatabaseObject child class specifying which type of class should be created and returned.

      • getData

        public void getData​(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference documentReference,
                    DatabaseListener listener,
                    DatabaseObject requestClassType)
        Finds the data located in the given document and gives it to the listener to publish.
        Parameters:
        documentReference - The DocumentReference which holds the reference to the requested data.
        listener - The Class which impliments the DatabaseListener * and holds the listener for the success of data fetching.
        requestClassType - The DatabaseObject child class specifying which type of class * should be created and returned.

      • getDocReferenceTo

        public com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference getDocReferenceTo​(Constants.COLLECTION_NAME collectionName,
                                                                         DatabaseObject data)
        This will return a reference to a document which can be then used in other classes. The intended purpose of this is to allow for references to be made attributes for specific classes.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - Enum of the collection name which the document is located.
        data - DatabaseObject of the document name which is being requested.
        Returns:
        DocumentReference referring to the requested document in the given path.

      • getDocReferenceTo

        public com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference getDocReferenceTo​(com.google.firebase.firestore.CollectionReference collection,
                                                                         DatabaseObject data)
        This will return a reference to a document which can be then used in other classes. The intended purpose of this is to allow for references to be made attributes for specific classes.
        Parameters:
        collection - CollectionReference of the collection name which the document is located.
        data - DatabaseObject of the document name which is being requested.
        Returns:
        DocumentReference referring to the requested document in the given path.

      • getCollectionReferenceTo

        public com.google.firebase.firestore.CollectionReference getCollectionReferenceTo​(Constants.COLLECTION_NAME collectionName)
        This will return a reference to a collection in the Firestore database. This collection but be stored in the document of the user in the first level of hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        collectionName -
        Returns:
        CollectionReference The reference to the collection requested.

      • updateData

        public void updateData​(Constants.COLLECTION_NAME collectionName,
                       DatabaseObject data)
        This performs the same function as addData(), created to create clarity on use.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - The Enum of the collection which holds desired document.
        data - DatabaseObject holding data to be stored in the document.
